snippet: Mitt Romney has leveled a fusillade of soft-on-China accusations at President Obama, but some experts say the challenger’s get-tough approach would backfire.
abstract: American policy toward China will come up during one or both of the remaining presidential debates; Mitt Romney has leveled a fusillade of soft-on-China accusations at President Obama, including allowing Chinese to manipulate their currency and distort fair trade, but some experts say his get-tough approach will backfire.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney has leveled a fusillade of soft-on-China accusations at President Obama, but some experts say the challenger’s get-tough approach would backfire.

headline.seo: China and Its Trade Tactics Are Coming to the Debates
headline.main: China and Its Trade Practices Are Coming to the Debates
headline.print_headline: China and Its Trade Practices Are Coming to the Debates
